name: Semax
overview: A synthetic peptide developed in Russia based on a fragment of ACTH (adrenocorticotropic hormone). It has been approved in Russia as a nootropic and neuroprotective agent, though it remains experimental in most other countries.
who_should_avoid: severe mental health conditions without medical oversight
interactions_notes: Limited interaction data outside of Russian research. May interact with stimulants, nootropics, and psychiatric medications. May affect stress hormone pathways.
dosing_ranges_literature: Russian protocols use nasal administration of 0.5-1 mg per day divided into 2-3 doses. Various concentrations exist (0.1%, 1%). Western clinical validation is lacking.
storage_notes: Store unreconstituted peptide in freezer (-20Â°C or colder). After reconstitution, store refrigerated and use within 2-3 weeks. Nasal formulations may have different storage requirements.

references.title: Semax: neuroprotective and nootropic peptide
references.note: Russian research on Semax's cognitive and neuroprotective effects.

references.title: ACTH-derived peptides in brain function
references.note: Overview of ACTH fragment peptides, primarily from Russian sources.
